Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2008 05:06PM Terryjohnson wrote: Hi Hummer, I guess you are a newer at this than I am but I am new to the chat room and would love to find as much as I can about all.  I had a 5 cm tumor never picked up on ultrasound or mamogram.  Had 5 punch biopsies that said bn.  Then had it removed and found out it is stage III infiltrating ductal carcinoma..  Have had 3 surgeries since November.  Finally got all with clear margins on December 17th with full mastectomy.  I have had an expander put in for later reconstruction but I go next week for chemo and the radiation.  I have 5 children, 45 years old and I plan to work as much as possible.  Good luck and let me know how your surgeries go.  The surgeries weren't so bad to me but the expander is giving me problems and I am trying to get info for that.  I hope all goes well for you.  If anything comes out of this is that I have found what wonderful friends and family I have throghout this ordeal.  I hope you find the same. Hugs and Prayers, Terry Johnson Suffolk VA
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed hummer Jen44

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2008 07:30PM Terryjohnson wrote: Howdy ladies, This is my first time in a chat room.  Just had my mastectomy drains and all on Dec 17, 2007.  Expander was added at that time for later reconstruction.  Having a few problems with that if anyone knows anything about them please let me know.  It feels like wires keep trying to protrude out.  Pain is an issue also. Stage 3 with 5 cm tumor.  After two surgeries finally have clean margins and clean lymphnodes.  My doctor wants agressive chemo which I see the oncologist this Thursday. Whatever that means. 30 rounds of Radiation after that then permanent emplants if possible for a matching pair.  (the only good news out of this).  I am 45 with 5 children. I work full time and home to work during the chemo and radiation.  I've already bought the coolest wig though... Thanks for  letting me share... Terry J
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2008 08:10PM Terryjohnson wrote: Thank You Kara
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2008 12:45PM Terryjohnson wrote: Hello October ladies, Thanks for the welcome.  I have just realized (stupid me) that the pain I have been feeling is the expander (unexpanded) moving around to strange places in the breast.  If I massage it back into place the pain will subside.  Yesterday I decided I can live without pain meds.  It may not be permanent but for now It is in my control and I feel good about.  Do some of you have expanders that wander out of the breast area>?  Just wondering if that is normal.  Reminds me of being pregnant with a baby and he has stuck his foot in the rib cage until you rub it back into place.  Does this sound normal?  See chemo guy in two days...getting antzie...I started walking a mile a day (my doc insists) five days ago.  Actually did 2 miles today.  I hope it keeps up.  I really feel good.  I know that won't last with the chemo but I also know half of this fight is attitute...Thanks for the eyes ears and shoulders.  I wish everyone well.  I will talk to you all weekly hopefully.  And I do have some help with my children.  My youngest is 11 and oldest 27.  So only three are left home.  Oldest child is severly handicapped which in itself can be a terrible thing but we are used to it now and we have a full time nurses aide that helps at home daily.  This now helps me more than you know.  Wouldn't know what to do without her.   Today was my 4th day back to work.  I do love it.. Bye for now....Terry J
